title: Temple and Centralization
objective: Explain Solomon's temple in covenant theology

required_passages.text: And Solomon stood before the altar of the LORD in the presence of all the congregation of Israel, and spread forth his hands toward heaven: And he said, LORD God of Israel, there is no God like thee, in heaven above, or on earth beneath, who keepest covenant and mercy with thy servants that walk before thee with all their heart: Who hast kept with thy servant David my father that thou promisedst him: thou spakest also with thy mouth, and hast fulfilled it with thine hand, as it is this day. Therefore now, LORD God of Israel, keep with thy servant David my father that thou promisedst unto him, saying, There shall not fail thee a man in my sight to sit on the throne of Israel; so that thy children take heed to their way, that they walk before me as thou hast walked before me. And now, O God of Israel, let thy word, I pray thee, be verified, which thou hast spoken unto thy servant David my father. But will God indeed dwell on the earth? behold, the heaven and heaven of heavens cannot contain thee; how much less this house that I have builded? Yet have thou respect unto the prayer of thy servant, and to his supplication, O LORD my God, to hearken unto the cry and to the prayer, which thy servant prayeth before thee to day: That thine eyes may be open toward this house night and day, even toward the place of which thou hast said, My name shall be there: and hearken thou to the prayer which thy servant shall make toward this place.

Solomon constructs the temple. It replaces the portable tabernacle. The temple becomes central to covenant worship. It is place where God dwells among his people.
The temple centralizes worship. Sacrifices are offered only in Jerusalem. The king mediates national covenant relationship. Temple becomes symbol of God's presence and covenant commitment.
Key themes: temple is God's house among his people. Centralized worship strengthens covenant identity. King mediates covenant. Prayer at temple expresses covenant faith.
What is the primary function of Solomon's temple?
segments.correct_answer: Central place of covenant worship and God's dwelling

vocabulary.definition: Concentration of worship practices and sacrifice in one location under priestly and royal oversight
Permanent building replacing the tabernacle as God's dwelling place and center of covenant worship

study_notes: The temple represents institutional maturity of covenant worship. Its destruction becomes significant as judgment on covenant violation.
